question: 米兵
sourceMnemonic: Remember how <ja>米国</ja> is "America." Well, more of that again. With <ja>米</ja> representing "America" you can combine that with <ja>兵</ja> (<kanji>soldier</kanji>) to have yourself a <vocabulary>US soldier</vocabulary> / <vocabulary>American soldier</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
